1: Although the rapid expansion of social media platforms has revolutionized the way individuals connect and share information, many experts express concern that it has also led to a decline in face-to-face interactions and a rise in feelings of isolation among users.
(1) The growth of social media has been universally praised for enhancing personal relationships and fostering deeper connections among individuals.
(2) Experts unanimously agree that social media has improved face-to-face interactions, resulting in a more connected society overall.
(3) While social media allows for easier communication, it is also associated with reduced in-person interactions and increased loneliness among its users.
(4) The widespread use of social media has completely eliminated the need for personal interactions, making them obsolete in modern society.
